visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the title 'Commonly used screen readers from 2009 to 2015'. The chart should display the usage percentages of various screen readers over time, with specific styling for axes and labels. The data series should include the names of the screen readers and their corresponding usage percentages. Custom colors should be applied to each series, and additional configurations should include a legend and tooltip settings.

title.text: Commonly used screen readers from 2009 to 2015

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart titled 'Commonly used screen readers from 2009 to 2015'. The chart displays the usage percentages of various screen readers over time, with specific styling for axes and labels. The y-axis is labeled with 'Percentage of respondents' and formatted to show values as percentages. The x-axis is labeled 'Time' and uses specific date categories. The tooltip is configured to split and display values with a '%' suffix. The data series includes the names of the screen readers and their corresponding usage percentages, each with custom colors and dash styles for differentiation. The legend is automatically generated based on the series names, and the chart is set to display a tooltip with split values for better readability.
